description.narrative: The project is expected to result in increased access to quality mobile connectivity for individuals and businesses in Togo, a country with large connectivity gaps, by increasing network capacity through the deployment of mobile networks, and by upgrading last-mile fiber broadband network. Furthermore, by supporting a large-scale expansion of high-speed broadband networks in a post-privatization context, this transaction is expected to raise the competitive pressure on alternative operators to improve their offering through a faster roll out of high-speed broadband networks.

The proposed investment comprises up to 50 million loan from IFCs own account and up to 72 million loan in mobilization to Togocom to support Togocom in modernizing and expanding its network as well as refinancing its existing loans.
